title: Fashion Shows in Paris and Milan Are Going On Despite Omicron
sub_head: Armani canceled its show earlier this year, but Louis Vuitton and other brands have returned to the catwalks
body:
The fashion houses of Paris and Milan are back on the runway this week, hosting their elaborate annual wintertime shows despite the rapid spread of the Omicron variant, another sign that parts of Europe are looking beyond the current Covid-19 wave and getting back to business.
Chanel SA sent a horse down the catwalk at its lavish in-person fashion show Tuesday night in Paris, part of Haute Couture Week there. Last week, Louis Vuitton unveiled a posthumous collection by its late artistic director, Virgil Abloh, who died late last year. Kenzo, another brand owned by LVMH MoÃ«t Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE, debuted its first collection by newly appointed creative director Nigo on Sunday.
